name: table_schema_specs_for_level_1_c2m2_encoding_of_dcc_metadata
title: A complete list of schematic specifications for the resources (TSV table files) that will be used to represent C2M2 Level 1 DCC metadata prior to ingest into the C2M2 database system.

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this file. The value of this field will be used together with id (assigned to each file by the DCC that owns it) as a paired-key structure formally identifying Level 1 file entities within the total C2M2 data space.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unrestricted-format string identifying this file, assigned by the DCC managing it. Can be any string as long as it uniquely identifies each file within the scope of a single Level 1 metadata submission.

fields.name: persistent_id
fields.description: A persistent, resolvable URI generated by a DCC and permanently attached to this file, to serve as a permanent address by which landing pages and/or other relevant decorations can eventually be attached to this file, including (optionally) resolution to a network location from which the file can be downloaded. Actual network locations MUST NOT be embedded directly within this identifier.

fields.name: size_in_bytes
fields.description: The size of a file in bytes.

fields.name: sha256
fields.description: The output of the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function after being run on this file. One or both of sha256 and md5 is required. sha256 is preferred.

fields.name: md5
fields.description: The output of the MD5 message-digest algorithm after being run as a cryptographic hash function on this file. One or both of sha256 and md5 is required. sha256 is preferred.

fields.name: filename
fields.description: A filename with no prepended PATH information.

fields.name: file_format
fields.description: An EDAM CV term identifying the digital format of this file (e.g. TSV or FASTQ).

fields.name: data_type
fields.description: An EDAM CV term identifying the type of information stored in this file (e.g. RNA sequence reads).

resources.name: bio_sample
resources.title: bio_sample
resources.description: A Level 1 tissue sample or other physical specimen

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this bio_sample. The value of this field will be used together with id (assigned to each bio_sample by the DCC that owns it) as a paired-key structure formally identifying Level 1 bio_sample entities within the total C2M2 data space.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unrestricted-format string identifying this bio_sample, assigned by the DCC managing it. Can be any string as long as it uniquely identifies each bio_sample within the scope of a single Level 1 metadata submission.

fields.name: persistent_id
fields.description: A persistent, resolvable URI generated by a DCC and permanently attached to this bio_sample, to serve as a permanent address by which landing pages and/or other relevant decorations can eventually be attached to this bio_sample. Actual network locations MUST NOT be embedded directly within this identifier.

fields.name: assay_type
fields.description: An OBI CV term describing the type of material represented by this bio_sample.

fields.name: host_species
fields.description: An NCBI taxon ID describing the species of the source organism (or host organism, in cases of microbiome samples) for this sample.

fields.name: anatomy
fields.description: An Uberon CV term locating the origin of this bio_sample within the physiology of its source (or host) organism.

resources.name: project
resources.title: project
resources.description: A node in the Level 1 project hierarchy for the given id_namespace

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing data from this project. The value of this field will be used together with id (assigned to each project by the DCC that owns it) as a paired-key structure formally identifying Level 1 project entities within the total C2M2 data space.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unrestricted-format string identifying this project, assigned by the DCC managing its data. Can be any string as long as it uniquely identifies each project within the scope of a single Level 1 metadata submission.

fields.name: persistent_id
fields.description: A persistent, resolvable URI generated by a DCC and permanently attached to this project, to serve as a permanent address by which landing pages and/or other relevant decorations can eventually be attached to this project. Actual network locations MUST NOT be embedded directly within this identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this project.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this project.

resources.name: subject
resources.title: subject
resources.description: A host organism from which a Level 1 bio_sample has been generated

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this subject. The value of this field will be used together with id (assigned to each subject by the DCC that owns it) as a paired-key structure formally identifying Level 1 subject entities within the total C2M2 data space.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unrestricted-format string identifying this subject, assigned by the DCC managing it. Can be any string as long as it uniquely identifies each subject within the scope of a single Level 1 metadata submission.

fields.name: persistent_id
fields.description: A persistent, resolvable URI generated by a DCC and permanently attached to this subject, to serve as a permanent address by which landing pages and/or other relevant decorations can eventually be attached to this subject. Actual network locations MUST NOT be embedded directly within this identifier.

resources.name: bio_sample_project
resources.title: bio_sample_project
resources.description: Association between a bio_sample and a (containing) project

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this bio_sample/project pair.

fields.name: bio_sample_id
fields.description: The ID of a bio_sample

fields.name: project_id
fields.description: The ID of a project

resources.name: bio_sample_subject
resources.title: bio_sample_subject
resources.description: Association between a bio_sample and a subject

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this bio_sample/subject pair.

fields.name: bio_sample_id
fields.description: The ID of a bio_sample

fields.name: subject_id
fields.description: The ID of a subject

resources.name: subject_project
resources.title: subject_project
resources.description: Association between a subject and a (containing) project

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this subject/project pair.

fields.name: subject_id
fields.description: The ID of a subject

fields.name: project_id
fields.description: The ID of a project

resources.name: subject_file
resources.title: subject_file
resources.description: Association between a subject and a file

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this subject/file pair.

fields.name: subject_id
fields.description: The ID of a subject

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: The ID of a file

resources.name: file_project
resources.title: file_project
resources.description: Association between a file and a (containing) project

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this file/project pair.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: The ID of a file

fields.name: project_id
fields.description: The ID of a project

resources.name: file_bio_sample
resources.title: file_bio_sample
resources.description: Association between a file and a bio_sample

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this file/bio_sample pair.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: The ID of a file

fields.name: bio_sample_id
fields.description: The ID of a bio_sample

resources.name: project_project
resources.title: project_project
resources.description: Association between a child project and its parent

fields.name: id_namespace
fields.description: String identifier assigned by CFDE to the DCC managing this parent-child project pair.

fields.name: parent_project_id
fields.description: The ID of the containing (parent) project

fields.name: child_project_id
fields.description: The ID of the contained (child) project

resources.name: assay_type
resources.title: assay_type
resources.description: List of Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI) CV terms used in this dataset to describe types of material that can be bio_samples

fields.name: id
fields.description: An OBI CV term

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this OBI term

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this OBI term

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate OBI terms) equivalent to this OBI term

resources.name: ncbi_taxonomy
resources.title: ncbi_taxonomy
resources.description: List of NCBI Taxonomy Database IDs used in this dataset to identify bio_sample source or host organisms by species

fields.name: id
fields.description: A species-level NCBI Taxonomy Database ID

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this species

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this species

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate NCBI Taxonomy IDs) equivalent to this species

resources.name: anatomy
resources.title: anatomy
resources.description: List of Uber-anatomy Ontology (Uberon) CV terms used in this dataset to locate the origin of a bio_sample within the physiology of its source or host organism

fields.name: id
fields.description: An Uberon CV term

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this Uberon term

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this Uberon term

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate Uberon terms) equivalent to this Uberon term

resources.name: file_format
resources.title: file_format
resources.description: List of EDAM CV 'format:' terms used in this dataset to describe file formats

fields.name: id
fields.description: An EDAM CV format term

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this EDAM format term

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this EDAM format term

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate EDAM format terms) equivalent to this EDAM format term

resources.name: data_type
resources.title: data_type
resources.description: List of EDAM CV 'data:' terms used in this dataset to describe data in files

fields.name: id
fields.description: An EDAM CV data term

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this EDAM data term

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this EDAM data term

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Pipe-separated list of synonyms (alternate EDAM data terms) equivalent to this EDAM data term

resources.name: namespace
resources.title: namespace
resources.description: CV: Dictionary of CFDE-generated terms describing identifier namespaces corresponding to top-level data sources like DCCs

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID representing this identifier namespace

fields.name: name
fields.description: A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this namespace

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of this namespace
